title: Dartboard Statistics
jupyter: python3
---

Start with our imports

```{python}
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import scipy
```

First we grab our data

```{python}
dartboard_data = pd.read_csv("Shahid_Sovereign_dartboard.csv")
dart_strikes = dartboard_data["Dart Strike"].to_numpy()
dartboard_data.head()
```
Plot the histogram

```{python}
plt.figure()
plt.hist(dart_strikes, bins=41, range=(-20,20))
plt.show()
```

This should be the most acurate histogram of the data and is plotted between -20 20 which is good. We can also do some stats on the data

```{python}
mean = np.mean(dart_strikes)
std = np.std(dart_strikes)
print(f"mean: {mean}, std: {std}")
```

We can then plot a normal curve over the histogram to get 

```{python}
x = np.arange(-20, 20)
y = scipy.stats.norm.pdf(x, mean, std) * 150 
plt.figure()
plt.hist(dart_strikes, bins=41, range=(-20,20), label="Experimental Data")
plt.plot(x,y, label="Calculated Distribution")
plt.legend()
plt.title("Normal Distribution of Dart Strikes")
plt.xlabel("Bin Number")
plt.ylabel("Frequency")
plt.show()
```
